| QuoteSource             = Venom Vol 2 25

| HistoryText             = Before being possessed by [[Demons|demons]], each one of the '''Monsters of Evil''' were ancient and powerful monsters. [[Gragoa (Earth-616)|Gragoa]] was once feared as a [[Gods of Earth|god]] in what is now the [[Harvey Elder (Earth-616)|Mole Man]]'s [[Subterranea|kingdom]]. [[Lord Tiki (Earth-616)|Lord Tiki]] was an ancient idol brought to life by a botched fertility ritual. [[Worm (Alien) (Earth-616)|The Worm]] was an [[Glossary:Alien|alien]] that came to [[Earth]] to study humanity, which she did by committing a string of cattle mutilations. Once the local farmers discovered she was the culprit, they destroyed her spaceship and the lab inside it. [[Skunk Ape (Earth-616)|Skunk Ape]] was a human scientist whose evolutionary research backfired, transforming him into a giant simian. [[Sphinx (Monster) (Earth-616)|The Sphinx]] was accidentally brought forward in time to the present from its native [[Egypt]] thanks to its own riddles and curses. At some point, each one of them was captured by [[Daimon Hellstrom (Earth-616)|Daimon Hellstrom]] and the [[Department of Occult Armaments (Earth-616)|D.O.A.]] and possessed them with demons, inducting them into their Monsters of Evil.

When confronted by [[Eugene Thompson (Earth-616)|Agent Venom]], Daimon Hellstrom possessed his foe's [[Venom (Symbiote) (Earth-616)|symbiote]] with a demon to turn him into one of his Monsters of Evil. Venom took control of the demon and fled to [[Katherine Kiernan (Earth-616)|Katherine Kiernan's]] apartment. She took him to her friend, Reggie, who tried to exorcise the demon from him. The demon, which wanted to be exorcised, couldn't break free because his vessel was dragging him back down, and explained that it was forbidden to possess those who bore the Hell-Mark. Reggie then advised Agent Venom to find whoever it was who did this to him.

[[File:Eugene Thompson (Earth-616) vs. Daimon Hellstrom (Earth-616) and the Monsters of Evil (Earth-616) from Venom Vol 2 24 001.jpg|thumb|280px|left|Hellstrom unleashes the Monsters of Evil]]
Agent Venom ambushed and attacked Daimon Hellstrom and some D.O.A. members at a zoo in Bronx. Hellstrom then unleashed the Monsters of Evil on Venom, but he fought through them to attack Hellstrom only to be flung by Gragoa across the zoo, into the reptile house. Hellstrom ordered the monsters to hunt him down, either to join them or to have his demon liberated by his death. Venom ambushed and attacked the Sphinx, and its screams summoned the other monsters. Venom controlled them to attack Hellstrom and after brutally beating him, Venom ordered them to leave, warning that if they became a threat to humans, he'd hunt them down. The Monsters of Evil obeyed and vanished into the woods.{{r|Venom Vol 2 #23|#25}}

After Venom and [[Andrea Benton (Earth-616)|Mania]] fought [[Brock Rumlow (Earth-616)|Crossbones]] when they were trying to make contact with [[Mephisto (Earth-616)|Mephisto]], the demon summoned the Monsters of Evil using a portal on Master Mayhem's chest to serve Mania, who was in possesion of the [[Venom (Symbiote) (Earth-616)|symbiote]]'s hell-mark, and she commanded them to defeat the [[Department of Occult Armaments (Earth-616)|D.O.A.]]. In the end, Mephisto sent the Monsters of Evil back home with some D.O.A. members as snacks for their trip.{{r|Venom Vol 2 42}}

When attacked by [[Cletus Kasady (Earth-616)|Carnage]], Andi summoned the Monsters of Evil to come to her aid. However, they proved no match for Carnage's [[Carnage IV (Symbiote) (Earth-616)|primordial symbiote]], who easily tore them to shreds.{{r|Web of Venom: Funeral Pyre Vol 1 1}}

| Notes                   = * They were created by [[Daimon Hellstrom (Earth-616)|Daimon Hellstrom]], and would be commanded by anyone possessing a hell-mark.{{r|Venom Vol 2 24}}
| Trivia                  = * The name "Monsters of Evil" appears to be a wordplay on the [[Masters of Evil (Earth-616)|Masters of Evil]].
